report_title: Online Greeting Card Sales in the US
executive_summary: The online greeting card industry has expanded as business operations and consumer preferences shift toward online shopping. The industry provides convenient and affordable alternatives to brick-and-mortar options. Mobile device usage has facilitated access. The pandemic drove growth as people turned to greeting cards while limiting physical interactions. Revenue is expected to grow at a 11.5% CAGR to $1.6 billion through 2024. Consumers seek lower prices, bulk options, and personalization online. Despite the pandemic impacting consumer spending, demand peaked as exposure to physical retailers was limited. Revenue grew 20.2% in 2022 but profit was pressured by competition.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Accelerated the Shift to Online Sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic provided growth as brick-and-mortar stores temporarily closed due to stay-at-home orders, limiting options for consumers who then turned online. Consumers also increased greeting card spending to stay in touch while limiting direct contact.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digital-Only Greeting Cards Capitalize on Eco-Conscious Trends
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising environmental sustainability concerns push consumers towards digital-only greeting cards which reduce paper waste while providing a meaningful gesture. Digital cards offer instant delivery appealing to last-minute or international senders.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: There is Growing Competition From Struggling Traditional Retailers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Traditional brick-and-mortar retailers like gift shops and bookstores maintain market share by targeting younger demographics with curated cards, gifts and events to build community. But the pandemic diminished this advantage as consumers reduced store visits.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Social Media Sharing Features Extend Reach
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Social media sharing features extend the reach of influencer and ad campaigns, contributing to organic growth and community building around brands.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Subscription Models Ensure Customer Retention and Steady Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Subscription services for regular customized card delivery are gaining popularity, providing steady revenue and reducing dependency on peak periods. Subscribers often get perks like discounts incentivizing long-term engagement.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Mobile Internet Access is Expected to Make Online Shopping Easier
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Increasing mobile internet connections will likely continue to support online retailers as more consumers possess mobile devices with reliable internet access. Broadband connections will also underpin growth by enabling reliable e-commerce access.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Personalization Will Be a Key Differentiator
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The growing number of greeting card retailers will likely create a more competitive environment. Consumer desire for unique connections fuels demand for personalized cards enabled by print-on-demand technology and data-driven recommendations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Augmented Reality (AR) Will Enhance Consumer Experience
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: AR technologies integrated into greeting cards provide interactive experiences. Enhanced engagement through AR can differentiate products and foster brand loyalty, appealing particularly to younger tech-savvy generations and expanding the potential market.

industry_definition: This industry sells greeting cards and e-cards online. The industry includes all online sales of physical and electronic greeting cards, but excludes brick-and-mortar sales of cards.
key_trends: The industry is characterized by a low level of concentration. Through the end of 2024, concentration has fallen slightly, as the industry's largest companies have adjusted to a changing landscape.

The two largest companies, Hallmark Cards Inc. (Hallmark) and American Greetings Corporation (American Greetings), have battled competition through acquisitions of small niche companies. Both companies have lost market share because of intense competition from smaller brands.

The industry has benefited from increasing consumer access to online stores. The number of broadband connections and the number of mobile internet connections has steadily expanded, supporting growth.

Increasing consumer spending will be the strongest catalyst for growth moving forward. With consumer confidence expected to improve, consumers will embrace discretionary products such as greeting cards.

products_and_services.product_description: Items in this category include personalized or customized invitations, announcements and stationery. Customers can choose their products, add text, images and other graphics, and then have them shipped through the company's website.

Holiday single cards are greeting cards specifically designed for Christmas, Hanukkah and Valentine's Day. They generate significant revenue during holidays when consumers are most likely to send greetings. Seasonal promotions and limited-time designs can further boost sales volumes.
Bulk cards are sets of multiple greeting cards sold together, often at a discounted rate. They attract budget-conscious customers who prefer to purchase multiple cards at once.

People with more disposable income are likelier to spend on personalized and niche products like online greeting cards. This drives growth as consumers seek unique and convenient ways to express sentiments, benefiting creators and retailers.
